I've been thinking about the Jedi.
They teach detachment.

I'm pretty sure I could not be a Jedi as I like to be directly confrontational in my dealings.
The way of the Dark Side calls.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537291076368720c79330000#post_537291076368720c79330000
I've got a couple of his albums and they're both pretty damn good. I'm not a big hip hop fan, but his music hits right in the sweet spot for me.

Generally I stick to punk, metal and rockabilly because that is music that makes me want to move, but there are also plenty of hip hop and rap artists who can do that as well (Sage Francis, NWA, Public Enemy, and the Wu Tang Clan all spring to mind.)

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537295506368721d05860000#post_537295506368721d05860000
I do like them, but only a few of their songs get played a lot on my ipod, (Sabotage, No Sleep Till Brooklyn and Brass Monkey most notably, No Sleep in particular is a fucking great driving song.)

I wouldn't say that my interest lies in rap-rock though as aside from Rage Against the Machine I don't really care for any self identified rap rock bands. Its more that I like hip hop that has a rock influence on it, also those Eminem tracks you linked to are fucking sweet.

Some trivia for you all: Richard Nixon was a fan of gansta rap. He liked the word play and the rapid diction.

thats the thing i love about eminem, its that dispite being in the boundaries of rap he experiments with all kids of other genres in combination, he has rap rock, horrorcore,ballads , west and east rap, electronic rap, political rap, alternative rap, comedy rap even country rap, so there is a little for everyoen to get into.

that trivia for some reason surprises me and not at the same time, i mean its kind of the few political figures that likes gangsta rap, aside from obama, but at the same time he had that badass feel around him that really doesnt fade you when he reveals that stuff.
